answers.answer:
Individuals struggling with drug use can access a range of support and services, including medical services (evaluation, counseling, and substitution treatment), psychological services (assessment, individual and group counseling), and social services (counseling and guidance). Specialized services like detoxification for both minors and adults, as well as overdose treatment and assistance, are also available.

To find detailed information, you can refer to the various organizations and their contact details provided in the summary. For instance, you can visit the National Anti-Drug Agency's website (http://ana.gov.ro) and explore their national network map to find local center details, or contact specific hospitals and clinics listed with their phone numbers and websites for more information on their services.
answers.bResponse:
Individuals struggling with drug use can access a range of support and services, including medical services (evaluation, counseling, and substitution treatment), psychological services (assessment, individual and group counseling), and social services (counseling and guidance). Specialized services like detoxification for both minors and adults, as well as overdose treatment and assistance, are also available.

To find detailed information, you can refer to the various organizations and their contact details provided in the summary. For instance, you can visit the National Anti-Drug Agency's website (http://ana.gov.ro) and explore their national network map to find local center details, or contact specific hospitals and clinics listed with their phone numbers and websites for more information on their services. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/support-for-drug-users

answers.answer:
The services provided by the National Anti-Drug Agency are confidential and free of charge. While many other listed services are also free, some private providers do offer paid services.

You can find this detailed information and more on the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/support-for-drug-users under the section dedicated to support for drug users.

answers.answer:
The National Anti-Drug Agency is the national agency that provides assistance to drug users in Romania.

You can find more detailed information on the webpage by visiting https://dopomoha.ro/en/support-for-drug-users and reading under the section "What should you do if you used drugs and now you need help" and "What services can help you if I you are a drug user and how you can access them".

For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/support-for-drug-users

answers.answer:
The National Anti-Drug Agency offers medical services including evaluation, counseling, and medical treatment (including substitution treatment); psychological services such as assessment, individual and group counseling; and social services like counseling and guidance within their network for drug users.

To find more detailed information, you can visit the National Anti-Drug Agency's website at http://ana.gov.ro or access the map of their national centers at http://ana.gov.ro/despre-institutie/reteaua-nationala/ to find contact details for a center in your county.

answers.answer:
You can contact the National Anti-Drug Agency by calling 0 800 87 00 70, 021 318 44 00, or 021.303.70.80, or by visiting their website at http://ana.gov.ro.

To find detailed information, visit the National Anti-Drug Agency's website at http://ana.gov.ro. You can find contact details for centers in all counties by accessing the map at http://ana.gov.ro/despre-institutie/reteaua-nationala/. For specific services and their contact numbers in Bucharest, refer to the sections on "Counseling services for juvenile drug users" and "Substitute treatment and medical, psychological and social assistance" on the webpage.

answers.answer:
In Bucharest, organizations providing substitute treatment and comprehensive assistance for drug users include the National Anti-Drug Agency, Center for Evaluation and Treatment of Drug Addicts for Young People „St. Stelian”, and Clinical Hospital of Psychiatry Prof.dr. Alexandru Obregia - Day stationary. Additionally, the Romanian Anti-AIDS Association (ARAS ARENA Center and ARAS Health Center), Color Mind Psychiatry and Psychotherapy Clinic, and ANIT Romania - Addiction Assistance and Treatment Center offer these services.

To find detailed information, visit the website dopomoha.ro/en/support-for-drug-users and read under the section "Substitute treatment and medical, psychological and social assistance" for Bucharest services.

answers.answer:
The National Anti-Drug Agency centers in Bucharest are located at Sos. Pantelimon, no. 255, sector 2; Sos. Berceni No. 10 - 12, sector 4; and Str. Pericle Gheorghiu, no. 15, sector 5. All three centers operate Monday to Friday, from 08:00 to 16:00.

To find more detailed information, you can access the map on the National Anti-Drug Agency's website at http://ana.gov.ro/despre-institutie/reteaua-nationala/, where you will find contact details for centers in various counties.

To find more detailed information, you can access the map on the National Anti-Drug Agency's website at http://ana.gov.ro/despre-institutie/reteaua-nationala/, where you will find contact details for centers in various counties. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/support-for-drug-users

answers.answer:
No, not all drug treatment facilities in Bucharest offer free services; some are paid. While many services, particularly those from the National Anti-Drug Agency and several hospitals, are free, other providers like ARAS Health Center, Color Mind Psychiatry and Psychotherapy Clinic, and ANIT Romania offer paid services.

To find this detailed information, navigate to the webpage and look under the section titled "In Bucharest you will find several types of services offered by the National Anti-Drug Agency or by other providers," where each listed facility specifies whether its services are "Free services," "Paid services," or a combination.

answers.answer:
Minors can receive drug detoxification services in Bucharest at the Clinical Hospital of Psychiatry Prof.dr. Alexandru Obregia - Department / Clinic of Child and Adolescent Psychiatry, and at the Grigore Alexandrescu Emergency Clinical Hospital for Children.

To find more detailed information, visit the website dopomoha.ro/en and navigate to the "support for drug users" section. Under this section, look for "Disintoxication services for minors".
